message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IT. 

This paper deals with approximate query processing on large databases, which is a common problem in the field of database systems (cs.DB). The paper also presents a sampling framework that optimizes the quality of multiple answers to group-by queries, which involves statistical analysis and optimization (cs.DS). The framework uses a metric based on the norm of the coefficients of variation (CVs), which is a statistical measure commonly used in machine learning and data analysis (cs.AI, cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses how the framework can be tuned to cases where partial information about a query workload is known, which involves information theory and optimization (cs.IT).
